page.title: 06WILDLIFE
page.content: {Animals.}Badgers are fairly plentiful despite an eradication scheme in 1983 to try and stamp out a pocket of bovine T.B.Foxes are common despite some shooting for pelts and hunting. Rabits and other rodents are in good numbers including some Harvest Mice, but no Dormice.Hedgehogs are in good numbers despite road casualties. {Insects.}More than 20 species of butterfly have been recorded in 1985 and about 10 species of dragonflies.{ {Birds.}On farmland the crow family are common especially Magpies.Ravens often fly over and Black-headed Gulls flock in winter.Pippits and chaffinches are common as are Pheasants but Partridge are more scarce. Birds of prey include Buzzard, Sparrowhawk,Kestral, and Tawny Owls but Barn Owls are very scarce.
